JUDGES: Alvina Gyulumyan;Corneliu Bîrsan;Egbert Myjer;Elisabet Fura;Josep Casadevall
TEXT: CARDINAL . NORP The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , PERSON , of ORG .
CARDINAL . NORP The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

CARDINAL . When the applicant retired , he obtained a retirement pension ( ålderspension ) . It appears that he was entitled only to the so - called supplementary pension , CARDINAL part of which depends on the retired person 's civil status .
CARDINAL . In DATE , at DATE , the applicant married .

CARDINAL . Consequently , in accordance with the Earnings - related Old Age Pension Act ( ORG om inkomstgrundad ålderspension , DATE hereafter “ the DATE LAW ) , on DATE ORG ( försäkrings - kassan ) in GPE decided to reduce the applicant 's pension . It appears that the applicant received MONEY ( SEK ) per month thereafter instead of the previous SEK CARDINAL,CARDINAL per month , thus a reduction of FAC CARDINAL per month ( MONEY ) .

CARDINAL . The applicant complained against the decision . He stated that , after the marriage , his pension was lower than it had been when he was single , although now he had to support CARDINAL persons as his wife did not have any income . ORG dismissed the complaint upon review on DATE .
CARDINAL . NORP The applicant brought the dispute before ORG ( länsrätten ) in GPE claiming that LAW was discriminatory and illogical and contrary to legal principles and human rights .
CARDINAL . By a judgment of DATE ORG found against the applicant , inter alia , stating as follows :

“ [ The applicant ] has questioned the [ DATE ] Act per se , as it distinguishes between married and unmarried pensioners and he states that the LAW thereby violates , inter alia , human rights . ORG notes however that marriage is an institution regulated by law which carries with it certain other rights and obligations than those concerning unmarried individuals . Having regard thereto and to [ the applicant 's ] observations , ORG can not find that the [ DATE ] Act , as challenged , manifestly runs counter to any rule of fundamental law or other superior statute or find that the adoption of the LAW significantly disregarded established regulation . Thus , ORG must apply the said law . Since [ the applicant ] is married , ORG calculated his pension fairly as for a married pensioner . Therefore the appeal shall be rejected . ”
CARDINAL . The applicant 's request for leave to appeal against the judgment was refused by ORG ( kammarrätten ) in GPE on DATE and by ORG ( Regeringsrätten ) on DATE .

CARDINAL . Under LAW , persons born DATE are , subject to certain criteria being met , entitled to CARDINAL types of pension upon retirement , income pension ( “ inkomstpension ” ) , regulated by LAW , and supplementary pension ( “ tilläggspension ” ) , governed by LAW .

CARDINAL . Income pension , to which the applicant was apparently not entitled , is based on how much a person has set aside for his or her pension while working and the life expectancy for persons born in DATE .
CARDINAL . Supplementary pension , which is at issue in the present case , consists of CARDINAL parts , defined in LAW , section CARDINAL of the CARDINAL Act :
“ Unless otherwise indicated in sections DATE , the DATE supplementary pension amounts to the total of

CARDINAL . PERCENT of the product of the price base amount [ prisbasbeloppet ] for DATE in question under LAW [ Lagen om allmän försäkring , CARDINAL:CARDINAL ] and the average pension points earned by the person entitled to the pension or , if pension points have been earned for DATE , the average of the CARDINAL highest points , and
CARDINAL . PERCENT of the price base amount for DATE in question under LAW or , if the person is married , PERCENT of this base amount . ”
